intro: Cyphostemma schlechteri, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by distinctive, orange-red berries. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Cyphostemma schlechteri is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
